revised_title: Root Structure and the Delivery of Solutes to the Xylem: A Review
tldr: This article discusses the various pathways and mechanisms through which solutes and water move within plant roots and are delivered to the xylem. It examines the structure and function of the endodermis, a crucial barrier that helps regulate the composition of the transpiration stream. The article also explores the limitations of current understanding and the need for further research to improve our knowledge of root function and solute transport.
